intro: Polygonum punctatum, commonly known as the spotted polygonum, is a herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Asia and North America. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features erect, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a reddish or purplish hue. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in dense spikes, and it produces tiny, three-lobed seeds. This plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and woodland edges.
